page1.title: We are giving away $9,000,000+ worth of $JOY tokens!
page1.subtitle: Here’s everything you need to know about Joystream, and information about how to receive $JOY tokens...

infoSection.title: What is Joystream?
infoSection.text: Joystream is a decentralized video platform and blockchain. It's powered by the native $JOY token. We built an application called Atlas, which is similar to video platforms that you are already familiar with, but it uses the underlying Joystream blockchain to let you upload videos to your channel, build up your subscriber count, sell your videos as NFTs, and even create your own token for your channel so that people can invest in you. Those token holders can earn a share of the revenue you generate, get early access to your videos, and all sorts of cool things that you control.

language.question: What language is Joystream built on?
language.answer: Joystream is built using Substrate, in the Polkadot ecosystem. Joystream itself is its own blockchain, and the $JOY token is a native asset on our blockchain.

polkadot.question: Is Joystream going for a Polkadot parachain auction?
polkadot.answer: In short, Joystream does intend to go for a Polkadot parachain slot, at the right time.

framework.question: What framework is Joystream built on?

page2.title: Joystream DAO is owned and governed by its token holders
page2.subtitle: Here’s what a DAO really is.. and how Joystream is governed by the token holders using our state of the art application...

footer.title: Go to next video
footer.subtitle: Become a Founding Member and split $9,000,000+ worth of $JOY

infoSection.title: Joystream as a DAO
infoSection.text:
DAO stands for Decentralized Autonomous Organization, and has been referred to as ‘An internet community with a shared bank account.
A DAO is the attempt to align the incentives of the consumers, or users of a product, with those running the organization. This is done by the use of tokens. By holding tokens, you become a partial owner of the organization, the same way that a stock gives you partial ownership of a company.
The difference is that you can use your ownership to influence the decisions of the organization. For example, you can apply to becoming a council member, or vote in the council member election. You can upload a proposal to suggest a new idea, and it will be voted on by the council. You can use your ownership to get your say in the direction of the organization, and not in a theoretical way, but in actual on-chain voting that cannot be defrauded. Also, everything is transparent, and out in the open for anyone to see, including budget & salaries.

infoSection2.title: Decentralized, and highly organized
infoSection2.text: One misconception about DAOs is that it's a free for all with no structure or leadership because there's no central owner. This is not the case. There is a system in place to organize all the people, much like in a traditional company.

council.question: What is the Council?
council.answer: The Joystream council is a group of individuals that have been elected by token holders to improve the platform.

workingGroups.question: What are Working Groups?
workingGroups.answer: Think of working groups like company departments, like a Marketing, or HR department for example.
